page.title: 18GEOLOGY OF THE SOUTH DOWNS
page.content: The fourth year classes went for a walk on the South Downs. We went up by Mr. Paul,s farm, Which is quite near our school. The south Downs are mostly made of chalk with bits of flint. Chalk is a sedimentary rock. A long Time ago it was made at the bottom of the sea in layers. When the sea creatures died their skeletons and shells went to the bottom of the sea and made a layers crushed the bottom bits into rock.We saw the chalk. It was all white and crumbly. You could write with it. Farmers like chalky soil because the water goes through it easily. Flint is very hard stone. It is black or grey and has sharp edges. cave men used flint for axes and spear heads.
